body_text.text: Rebecca Knowles et al. (176–188) collate data from 20 low- and middle-income countries.
body_text.section: Reliable access to antibiotics ::: Bangladesh, Benin, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Egypt, Guyana, Haiti, Kenya, Malawi, Mauritania, Namibia, Nepal, Rwanda, Senegal, Sierra Leone, Somalia, Togo, Uganda, United Republic of Tanzania, Zambia, Zimbabwe

body_text.text: Andres I Vecino-Ortiz & Deivis N Guzman-Tordecilla (169–175) study gun-carrying restrictions and gun-related mortality
body_text.section: What works to reduce fatal shootings? ::: Colombia

body_text.text: Shatrunajay Shukla et al. (207–212) describe the expansion of regulatory scope to medical devices.
body_text.section: Medical devices and adverse events ::: India

body_text.text: Benjamin TB Chan et al. (160–168) evaluate measures to improve quality of care for patients with chronic diseases.
body_text.section: Treating hypertension, diabetes and chronic heart failure ::: Kazakhstan

body_text.text: Worarat Imsanguan et al. (83–84) provide infection prevention recommendations for contacts of people with tuberculosis.
Hugo Perazzo et al. (189–198) review the evidence of effectiveness for generic direct-acting agents.
Matthew A Dixon et al. (199–206) model the effects of Taenia solium control strategies.
Gautam Bhan (220–222) examine the links between informal work and maternal and child health.
body_text.section: Hidden determinants of early childhood outcomes ::: Global

body_text.text: David H Jernigan & Pamela J Trangenstein (223–225) explore next steps for WHO’s global alcohol strategy.
body_text.section: Reducing the harmful use of alcohol ::: Global

body_text.text: James L Nuzzo & James Steele (226–227) argue for a causal systems map.
body_text.section: Factors that influence physical activity  ::: Global

body_text.text: Harry Rutter et al. (227–228) outline systems approaches to support physical activity.
body_text.section: Factors that influence physical activity  ::: Global
